intro: Anthericum autumnale, commonly known as autumn crocus, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking purple or lilac-colored flowers that bloom in the autumn. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces berries that contain toxic seeds. It is often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care.
